title: Example-Based Language Learning Design Using Attention-Guided Instructional Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Language education course suitable for novice managers/leaders, conducted through a blended approach combining face-to-face workshops and online modules, with learners participating via personal devices

learning_goals: Learners can accurately identify core patterns in language examples with over 80% precision using attention-guiding techniques.
Learners can reconstruct complex sentences with over 70% accuracy by integrating visual cues (eye movement) and verbal explanations.
Learners can record and improve learning outcomes applying attention-focused strategies at least twice through formative assessments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
